SENT.plain: Protein C, a vitamin K-dependent protein, is a blood coagulation inhibitor
A 31-year-old woman developed cerebral infarction followed by late psychomotor seizures, and thrombosis in the inferior mesenteric vein and bilateral crural veins
Her mother died of cerebral thrombosis in her 30's
Her elder brother died of suspected purpura fulminans immediately after birth
Her protein C activity and protein C antigen level decreased markedly and were less than 5% of those of normal controls and 0.3 microgram/ml, respectively
Her father, a paternal aunt and a maternal uncle also showed a low protein C activity and protein C antigen level
This patient seems to have congenital protein C deficiency which produced thrombosis in the leg veins and the mesenteric vein, probably cerebral infarction
